contentList.content: You can replace one of your Eldritch Invocations with another.
Change Eldritch Invocation
Monks are united in their ability to magically harness the energy that flows in their bodies.
Monk
You can replace one of your Maneuvers with another.
Martial Versatility: Maneuvers
This book is granted to those that have created a pact with any given patron. It contains a list of all cantrip level spells that can be learned, though the absorption of such knowledge is limited.
Book of Shadows
Recover 1 level 3 <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Giant Boar
Wild Shape: Fire Elemental
Wild Shape: Earth Elemental
Wild Shape: Water Elemental
Wild Shape: Air Elemental
You can change your Fighting Style selection.
Martial Versatility
You employ tactics that protect you from certain threats. Choose one of the following features.
Defensive Tactics
You learn to combat multiple threats at once. Choose one of the following features.
Multiattack
You bolster your defenses against various assaults. Choose one of the following features.
Superior Hunter's Defense
Ki Points are used to fuel various ki features.
Ki Points
Elemental Discipline
Choose an elemental discipline.
Change Elemental Discipline
You can replace one of your Elemental Discipline with another.
Unarmored Movement
Unarmored Movement
Unarmored Movement
Unarmored Movement
Unarmored Movement
When you aren't wearing armour, your movement is increased by [1]. At 9th level, you gain expertise in the Acrobatics and Athletics skills.
When you aren't wearing armour, your movement is increased by [1]. At 9th level, you gain expertise in the Acrobatics and Athletics skills.
When you aren't wearing armour, your movement is increased by [1]. At 9th level, you gain expertise in the Acrobatics and Athletics skills.
When you aren't wearing armour, your movement is increased by [1]. At 9th level, you gain expertise in the Acrobatics and Athletics skills.
When you aren't wearing armour, your movement is increased by [1]. At 9th level, you gain expertise in the Acrobatics and Athletics skills.
You have plundered magical knowledge from a wide spectrum of disciplines.
Magical Secrets
You gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs.
Metamagic
You can switch one of your Metamagic options with another.
Sorcerous Versatility
In some cultures this strong, single-edged sword is a symbol of honor and prestige.
Katana
A simple of garments for the wandering monk.
Monk Garb
Pseudodragon
Additional Fighting Style
Adopt an additional style of fighting to add to your specialty.
Mystic Arcanum

Your patron bestows upon you a magical secret called an arcanum. Choose one 6th-level spell, one 7th-level spell at 13th level, one 8th-level spell at 15th level and one 9th-level spell at 17th level from the warlock spell list as your arcanums, allowing you to cast it once until you finish a long rest.
Signature Spells
You gain mastery over two powerful spells and can cast them with little effort.
Bestial Aspect
Choose your Bestial Aspect. You can change your Aspect whenever you level up.
Bestial Attunement
Choose your Bestial Attunment. You can change your Attunment whenever you level up.
Change Aspect
You can change your Bestial Aspect selection.
Change Attunement
You can change your Bestial Attunement selection.
The shadowy force behind the weapons wielded by Hexblade offers them great power.
Hexblade
Specter

Your hex grows more powerful. If the target cursed by your Hexbladeâ€™s Curse hits you with an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you can use your reaction to roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, the attack deals no damage to you.

Place a baleful curse on a creature. While cursed, you gain a bonus equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to damage rolls against the cursed target, any <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> you make against the cursed target is a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> on a roll of 19 or 20 and if the cursed target dies, you regain [1].

Touch a weapon you are proficient with and lacks the two-handed property. When you attack with that weapon, you can use your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
The specter gains a bonus to its <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> modifier.

Place a baleful curse on a creature. While cursed, you gain a bonus equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to damage rolls against the cursed target and any <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> you make against the cursed target is a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> on a roll of 19 or 20.

If a target cursed by your Hexbladeâ€™s Curse hits you with an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you can use your reaction to roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, the attack deals no damage to you.
In combat, a bladesinger uses a series of intricate, elegant maneuvers that fend off harm and allow the bladesinger to channel magic into devastating attacks and a cunning defense.
Bladesinging
Choose a type of one-handed melee weapon to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in.
Training in War and Song

You can direct your magic to absorb damage while your Bladesong is active. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to expend one <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> and reduce that damage to you by an amount equal to five times the <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot's</LSTag> level.
You can add your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> modifier (minimum of +1) to the damage of your melee weapon attacks while your Bladesong is active.
When you would take damage, you can expend a Level [1] <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> and reduce the damage dealt to you by [2].
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Effect ends when you have less than half of your total Movement.

Gain the ability to move up your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> without provoking <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag> and restore [1] to allied creatures within [2] once.

Forge an empowering bond among yourself or your allies. While bonded, creatures within [1] of each other can add a [2] bonus an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> it makes once per turn.
Add bonus of +[1] to an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.

You can forge an empowering bond among people who are at peace with one another. As an action, you choose [1] allied creatures within [2] of you (including yourself) and create a magical bond among them or until you use this feature again. While any bonded creature is within [2] of another, the creature can add a bonus of +[3] to an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> it makes once per turn.
Activate to add a bonus of +[1] to <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Weapon already affected by the Hex Warrior feature.
Cannot be used on a two handed weapon.
Bladesong
Invoke an elven magic called the Bladesong, gracing you with supernatural speed, agility and focus as long as you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor or using a shield.
Your Bladesong ends early if you are incapacitated, if you don medium or heavy armor or a shield, or if you use two hands to make an attack with a weapon.
Armor Class and Constitution Saving Throws to maintain concentration increased by [1] and have Advantage on Acrobatics.
Dismiss Bladesong
Can make an additional free attack or cast a cantrip after making an unarmed or weapon attack.
Song of Defense
When suffering damange, use your reaction to expend one spell slot and reduce that damage to you by an amount equal to five times the spell slot's level
Song of Victory
Damage of your melee weapon attacks increased by [1] while your Bladesong is active.
Your resource for using the Blade Song feature.
